page.title: 11Interview with Riverside M.P
page.content: Riverside is a new consituency, formed from the old Aigburth and Vauxhall constituencies. Mr Robert Parry of the Labour Party is its first M.P. He believes that the {International {Garden Festival }has put Liverpool on on the map, providing badly needed jobs and trade for local businesses, albeit for a limited period. He feels that the major problems in the area are unemployment, (especially for youngsters), crime, vandalism,drug taking and poor housing. However, new legislation on hard drugs and the city council's designation of the area as a{HOUSING PRIORITY AREA}should improve the present situation. With the local bottling plant soon to close, the future for Riverside looks grim, although Mr.Parry believes that the general situation could improve if the right action were taken.
